headline: CNN Live Event/Special
subHeadline: Joe Biden: We're The United States Of America; Jill Biden On Juneteenth; Joe Biden On Juneteenth. Aired 9-10p ET

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENT, UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
utterances.sentences: As the gospel song goes, "We've come too far from where we started. Nobody told me that the road would be easy. I don't believe He brought me this far to leave me."(AUDIENCE CHEERS & APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: CORBIN REID, ACTRESS, RUN THE WORLD
utterances.sentences: This is a historic moment.SHANNON THORNTON, ACTRESS, P-VALLEY: This is the White House's first Juneteenth celebration.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN
utterances.sentences: To me, making Juneteenth a federal holiday wasn't just a symbolic gesture. It was a statement of fact for this country.BRANDEE EVANS, ACTRESS, P-VALLEY: I mean, we've been celebrating it for years. We've been waiting on everybody else to catch up.

utterances.speaker: BRESHA WEBB, ACTRESS, RUN THE WORLD
utterances.sentences: We're celebrating Juneteenth.

utterances.speaker: KAMALA HARRIS, VICE PRESIDENT, UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
utterances.sentences: We gather here, steps from where the Emancipation Proclamation was signed, to celebrate America's newest national holiday.

utterances.speaker: LARENZ TATE, ACTOR, POWER BOOK II
utterances.sentences: GHOST

utterances.speaker: WEBB
utterances.sentences: I am here, celebrating my ancestors.

utterances.speaker: AMBER STEVENS WEST, ACTRESS, RUN THE WORLD
utterances.sentences: It's really nice that we get to be here, today, to celebrate Juneteenth. This has been a very important holiday, in the Black culture, for a long time.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Imagine what this fight would have been like without the voice of the community.Thank you. Thank you. You full my heart in a way you do (ph). (AUDIENCE CHEERS & APPLAUSE) GAIL BEAN, ACTRESS, P-VALLEY: Being able to celebrate Juneteenth, at the White House, shows that the White House is taking the lead, on how we should operate, in togetherness and love and freedom of each other.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN
utterances.sentences: We're the United States of America, and there's nothing -- nothing beyond our capacity when we act together.(AUDIENCE CHEERS & APPLAUSE) (END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Everyone, please welcome Jimmy Jam.(AUDIENCE CHEERS & APPLAUSE) (MUSIC) JIMMY JAM, MUSICIAN, SONGWRITER & PRODUCER: Hey. Happy Juneteenth everybody. (AUDIENCE CHEERS & APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: JAM
utterances.sentences: Now, it's rare when a saxophonist achieves global superstardom. But that's exactly what Mike Phillips has done. And he is here, tonight -- he's here tonight, to perform some hits that we all love, by the legends, Chaka Khan, Stevie Wonder and Michael Jackson.(AUDIENCE CHEERS & APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: JAM
utterances.sentences: But first, my boy, Adam Blackstone, who's been up here playing, with all the artists that you've seen here, tonight.(AUDIENCE APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: JAM
utterances.sentences: Now, he just dropped his debut album, "Legacy." And he's going to perform a song, for you, right now.(AUDIENCE CHEERS & APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: After the break, a live performance, by global sensation, Davido.Plus, a special performance by Tank, of Tank and the Bangas. And later, Chloe and Big Freedia take the stage, when our Juneteenth: Celebration for Freedom continues. (COMMERCIAL BREAK) (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: ABDUL ABDULLAH, FOUNDER, AFROFUTURE FESTIVAL
utterances.sentences: People tend to think about Africa, like as one country, where they have 54 different countries, several different experiences, within each country. Now, we don't have anywhere we can go, and celebrate these cultures. And we've created one to be able to do that.

utterances.speaker: ABDULLAH
utterances.sentences: We're in a very unique time, where everybody wants to have a greater education about themselves. Black people have different experiences, across the world, but similar experiences. You're not alone in the world.AfroFuture Festival, for us, was an opportunity to bring together the Black diaspora. They feel seen, as soon as they touch down on the ground.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: The art, culture and music of the motherland, is creating an energy that is now re-centering Africa's presence in the world. Now, a multibillion-dollar industry, Afrobeats Music is playing a key role, in the global spotlight being put on the continent.

utterances.speaker: ABDULLAH
utterances.sentences: We wanted our music to become world music. And now, you're hearing new sounds that are changing your perspective. So, it's pretty exciting. And I think there is a connection between the diaspora connecting, and the music taking off.Our powers, as the global Black diasporas, within each other, and the more we get to know each other is the more that we're able to really hone that power. (END VIDEOTAPE) (AUDIENCE CHEERS & APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Greek Theatre, please welcome multi-platinum Nigerian superstar Davido.(MUSIC) (AUDIENCE CHEERS & APPLAUSE) DAVIDO, AMERICAN-NIGERIAN SINGER-SONGWRITER: What's up L.A.? (AUDIENCE CHEERS & APPLAUSE) (MUSIC) (VIDEO -- DAVIDO -- "FALL") (AUDIENCE CHEERS & APPLAUSE) (VIDEO -- DAVIDO -- "FALL")

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Welcome back to JUNETEENTHYou may know her from her chart-topping viral music. Please welcome Grammy Award-winning singer and songwriter, Muni Long. (AUDIENCE CHEERS & APPLAUSE) MUNI LONG, SINGER-SONGWRITER: To be a sister, with a voice, within the Melanated community, we collectively understand that this is a gift that comes with much responsibility. Sisters with Voices have been tasked with carrying us through our heartbreak, our breakthroughs, our loves, our losses, and our triumphs. It's an honor to be here, celebrating Melanated music, as part of CNN's "Juneteenth: Global Celebration For Freedom" concert. (AUDIENCE CHEERS & APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: LONG
utterances.sentences: These three ladies have paved the way, for a girl like me, with the voice of a diva, and a mouth full of gold (ph), and became one of the best-selling girl groups of all time.(AUDIENCE CHEERS & APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: LONG
utterances.sentences: Here to perform a medley of some of the songs, we have all saying, for hours and hours.(AUDIENCE CHEERS & APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: LONG

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: And now, a special message, from the President, and first lady, of the United States.(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN
utterances.sentences: One of the great honors I've had, as your President, was signing the law, making Juneteenth, a national holiday, the first new federal holiday since Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Day, nearly four decades ago.JILL BIDEN, FIRST LADY OF THE UNITED STATES, JOE BIDEN'S WIFE: Two years after the Emancipation Proclamation was signed, 250,000 enslaved people, in Texas, finally learned that they were free. Juneteenth celebrates the joy of freedom, of holding on to hope, of the struggle for equality, of the power and strength of this community.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN
utterances.sentences: We're the only nation in the world founded on an idea that we're all created equal in the image of God and deserve to be treated equally throughout our lives. Juneteenth is a reminder of that essential truth.

utterances.speaker: JILL BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Juneteenth was not just an ending. It was a new beginning, a second independence, one for all Americans that begin a new chapter, in our fight, for equality and justice.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN
utterances.sentences: And on this day, we remember, we must not rest until we deliver a true promise of America to all Americans.

utterances.speaker: JILL BIDEN
utterances.sentences: We hope you enjoy this amazing festival of music.Happy Juneteenth, America.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Happy Juneteenth, America.(END VIDEOTAPE) (AUDIENCE CHEERS & APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: In honor of the late legend, Tina Turner, performing "What's Love Got to Do with It," please welcome Chloe.(AUDIENCE CHEERS & APPLAUSE) (MUSIC) CHLOE BAILEY, AMERICAN SINGER-SONGWRITER: Rest in Power to the great Tina Turner. (AUDIENCE CHEERS & APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: BAILEY

utterances.speaker: BAILEY
utterances.sentences: Thank you. Happy Juneteenth.(AUDIENCE CHEERS & APPLAUSE)
